notesStmt.note: Lacunae after folios 2, 54, 80, 96, 101, 106, 114. Missing portions at the beginning and at the end. Only a part of folio 57 is preserved. Several leaves damaged.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Portions of the Judeo-Arabic commentary on the books I-V of Maimonides' Mishneh Torah, in the form of questions and answers.

msItem.title: Perush Mishneh Torah פירוש משנה תורה

collation.p: Quires of 10 leaves each, signed with Hebrew letters at the end, and also marked with catchwords. Only the quires no. 3-5, 7-8, and 10 are complete.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Comm. on Mishneh Thorah. Book XI. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2745.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Nicolas Mavrocordato: purchased by the British Museum from him on 04 March 1884: inscribed, folio [121v].
